intro: Disporum mishmiensis, commonly known as the Mishmi Disporum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats at high altitudes. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in its natural environment. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
